skill.name: openalex-database
skill.description: Query and analyze scholarly literature using the OpenAlex database. This skill should be used when searching for academic papers, analyzing research trends, finding works by authors or institutions, tracking citations, discovering open access publications, or conducting bibliometric analysis across 240M+ scholarly works. Use for literature searches, research output analysis, citation analysis, and academic database queries.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or persistence behaviors found. Network use is limited to the OpenAlex API for documented query workflows.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable scholarly metadata is slow and fragmented. This skill queries OpenAlex and summarizes works, trends, and citations with reusable helpers.
actual_capabilities: Search works with full text, filters, sorting, and field selection
Resolve authors or institutions by name, then fetch related works
Batch lookup works by DOI or other identifiers
Paginate large result sets with rate limiting and retries
Generate random samples and grouped trend summaries
Analyze research output with OA rate and top topics
limitations: Subject to OpenAlex rate limits and response size caps
Returns metadata only, not full text content
Coverage depends on OpenAlex data quality

use_cases.title: Literature discovery
use_cases.description: Find recent and highly cited papers on a topic with filters and sorting.

use_cases.title: Institution reporting
use_cases.description: Summarize institutional output, OA share, and top topics over time.

use_cases.title: Bibliometric trends
use_cases.description: Build publication trend tables and random samples for analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Find papers by author
prompt_templates.prompt: Find papers by Jennifer Doudna from 2020 to 2024. Return titles, years, and citation counts.

prompt_templates.title: Open access topic scan
prompt_templates.prompt: List open access papers about climate change from 2022 onward. Include DOI and OA status.

prompt_templates.title: Institution output summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze MIT research output since 2020. Report total works, OA percentage, and top topics.

prompt_templates.title: Large scale extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve up to 5000 quantum computing papers from 2022 to 2024 and export a table with title, year, citations, DOI.

output_examples.input: Analyze Stanford University research output from 2020 to 2024.
output: Top topics: Machine Learning, Genomics, Climate Science
Publications by year: 2020 to 2024 trend summary

best_practices: Provide an email to use the polite pool for faster rate limits
Use the two step pattern to resolve entity IDs before filtering
Select only needed fields and use per page 200 for efficiency
anti_patterns: Filtering by author or institution name directly in the works filter
Using random page numbers for sampling instead of the sample parameter
Requesting unlimited results without pagination limits

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows that can run Python.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Yes. OpenAlex enforces rate limits and per request result caps.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into existing scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Import the client and helper functions in your Python code.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. It only sends your queries to the public OpenAlex API.

faq.question: What if results are empty?
faq.answer: Check filter syntax and use the two step ID lookup pattern.

faq.question: How does it compare to other databases?
faq.answer: It offers open metadata coverage and no API key, but content depth varies.
